Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or Type B1 kantharos; white slip (very worn on exterior); interior glazed streaky black; lotus flower in added white outline above added red and white bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic details and the absence of decoration on the exterior surface make it impossible to determine whether it comes from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior; given the size and preservation of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1466) (phase 2)
